definition: variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
violent crime/to commit a violent act (assault or murder)
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]

sentences.english: The rain came down with a vengeance.
"Do you marry me?" Colleagues head open "fierce" light.
The speed and ferocity of the Lehman Brothers crisis brought the world to the brink of a meltdown.
sentences.chinese: 雷曼兄弟危機的快速和兇猛將世界帶到了崩潰的邊緣。

sentences.english: Honestly, it was our most dramatic marital fight to date.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，這是我們結婚來吵得最兇的一次。

sentences.english: The fierce rat is tussling with a grown rabbit.
sentences.chinese: 又大又兇的老鼠在跟大兔子扭鬥了。

sentences.english: People who smoke, smoke more on high-stress days.
sentences.chinese: 而且那些抽菸的人，在壓力過大時抽得更兇了。

sentences.english: Don't be hard on the bonny lass .
sentences.chinese: 別對這個漂亮的小姑娘這麼兇吧。

sentences.english: So the cry of the more ominous.
Art thou not afraid of nightmares and hideous dreams?
sentences.chinese: 你難道不怕睡魘和兇夢嗎？

sentences.english: That mean-looking dog is actually harmless.
sentences.chinese: 那隻看起來很兇的狗其實不會傷人。

sentences.english: I couldn't withstand a murderous-looking knife .
sentences.chinese: 我無法忍受兇光閃閃的刀。

sentences.english: The manager had a fierce face, and the customers also lacked pleasant voices.
sentences.chinese: 掌櫃是一副兇臉孔，主顧也沒有好聲氣。

sentences.english: He doesnt smoke as heavily as his brother.
sentences.chinese: 他不像他的兄弟抽菸抽得那麼兇。

sentences.english: I felt like, "Mom and Dad never argue like this."
sentences.chinese: 我感覺像是“我爹媽吵得最兇的時候。”

sentences.english: He used to smoke a lot.
My father's bark is worse than his bite.
sentences.chinese: 我家老頭兒吠得比咬得更兇。

definition: bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost
to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
